citeinfo.title: Copepods - Aetideidae of the World Ocean

descript.abstract: This taxonomic reference work, produced with the ETI branch in St. Petersburg Russia, provides multimedia information covering all species of the Calanoid Copepods of the family Aetideidae in the World Ocean. Aetideidae occur in all vertical ranges of the marine pelagic zone. Most of the meso- and bathypelagic species are characterized by wide geographical ranges, occurring from tropical to polar waters. This CD-ROM holds a comprehensive and fully up-to-date account on Aetideidae, including extensive species decriptions (with more than 2600 illustrations). A new and highly detailed illustrated key provides easy access to the information on the taxa. An interactive glossary of terms (defining about 220 terms) makes part of this unique program that provides information on 166 species and 32 higher taxa. Principal literature references were included. This CD-ROM is an excellent addition to any scientific library on taxonomy and marine biology.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this CD is to serve as a taxonomic reference work on copepods.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD software')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

A new and highly detailed illustrated key provides easy access to the information on the taxa. overview.eaover: Entity - Copepoda (Aetideidae); Attributes - species descriptions, geographic ranges, taxonomy.

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The Copepods CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 95/98, Pentium CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher. Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 680x0/PowerPC CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher.
